definition: Silkworms in Spring (1933), Chinese silent movie in socialist realist style, based on novel by Mao Dun 茅盾[Mao2 Dun4]

sentences.english: The duration of high humidity lasted much longer in spring than that in summer.
sentences.chinese: 春蚕期高湿的持续时间长于夏蚕期。

sentences.english: Life is like a spring silkworm cocoon, since bound up, once eyebrow feather, drill into the also in me.
sentences.chinese: 人生如春蚕，作茧自缠裹，一朝眉羽成，钻破亦在我。

sentences.english: The silk sacrifice themselves to produce silk which keepd people warm.
sentences.chinese: 春蚕用自己的生命吐出细细的蚕丝，为人们带来温暖。

sentences.english: As spring gave the lifetime loyalty.
sentences.chinese: 就象那春蚕献出一生的忠诚。

sentences.english: So, you learn spirit, so that put a beautiful tapestry of the motherland.
sentences.chinese: 于是，你把春蚕的精神汲取，让祖国披上美丽的织锦。

sentences.english: The teacher is the silkworm, the last thread and self.
sentences.chinese: 老师是春蚕，吐尽自我最后一根丝线。

definition: (of spiders, caterpillars, silkworms etc) to extrude silk
the cuckoo cries blood/fig. plaintive lament
to pupate/to turn into a chrysalis
